result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan J. Winkler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with all other probations

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge 
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF4

records.addlTxt: original filed in 15CF4

Defendant Dylan J. Winkler in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF324, 14CF409, 15CF4, 15CF26

3:30 p.m.  Court calls the case. 
 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF324 - GUILTY
15CF4 Counts 2, 3 & 4 - NO CONTEST
15CF26 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of the following: 
14CF324  (Defendant agrees to the prior conviction).
15CF4 Counts 2, 3 & 4 - 
15CF26 Count 1
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.

Dismissed and read-in are the following: 
15CF4 Count 1
15CF26 Count 2
14CF409

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Schmidt re: jail credit. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF4 Count 2
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months:
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All medicationss from 1 pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases so his agent can monitor what type of medications he is on and medical records. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment and with the approval of his agent. 
Maintain fulltime employment or go to school fulltime or a combination thereof.
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by his agent.
No contact with Joshua White with the exception of a letter of apology within the first 30 days of probation and that goes to the agent for approval to make sure it is sincere. 
Submit a DNA sample.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
Serve 1 year jail. 
70 days credit. 
First 6 months must be in jail.  Last 6 months can be on GPS electronic monitoring if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration.
Huber for employment and counseling he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time.
Pay restitution of $150 to Joshua White.  

15CF4 Count 3 -
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months, concurrent with Count 2:
Comply with all conditions set forth in Count 2. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Serve 1 year jail. 
70 days credit. 
First 6 months must be in jail.  Last 6 months can be on GPS electronic monitoring if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration.
Huber for employment and counseling he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time.

15CF4 Count 4 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions set forth in Counts 2 & 3. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF26 Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months, concurrent with his other probations:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF4. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
69 days jail credit.

14CF324 -
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF4.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Atty Schmidt agrees there is no pre-trial incarceration credit in 14CF324. 

BY THE COURT:  Any bond posted in any of the files is to be applied to restitution/fines/costs.  Any balance left over can be returned to the posters of the bond.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Karl Schmidt
PCJP Day Report Oversite
/s/ TTF 01/26/16 - granted
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference at 02-29-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Dylan J. Winkler in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-409, 15CF-4, 15CF-26 and 14CF-324.

2:32 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea today.

Court has been handed a motion to withdraw.

Atty Renc addresses the Court as to the motion to withdraw.

Atty Renc is concerned the communication is not there for the kind of representation Defendant deserves.

Defendant addresses the Court, if there is miscommunication, best interest would be is to have another attorney.

Court takes a moment to review the files and motion.

Court addresses the parties. Defendant paid the balance of the bond in 15CF-4 - $5,000.
Atty Renc addresses the Court regarding written stip that the number of day report days was reduced, explains the reduction.

Defendant was just laid off from Worzalla and Sons Potatoes.
Public Defender's office will appoint another attorney. 

These cases are going on almost a year and a half old. Matter was set for a plea today, there was a request for change of counsel for reasons as to relationship being broken.

BY THE COURT:
Court grants request. Atty Renc may withdraw.
Public Defender's office will appoint a new attorney within 48 hours.
Matters will be put back on the next pretrial calendar.
Court willl modify the bond in 15CF-4 to day report 7 times per week.
Other bonds will continue.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing at 01-26-2016 02:15 pm
Status conference at 10-14-2015 08:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 05-18-2015 09:00 am
Plea hearing at 04-17-2015 11:15 am
Plea hearing on March 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on February 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dylan J. Winkler in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF324, 14CF409

Atty Knaapen states the parties were prepared to proceed with a VIP.  However, they have received a new referral so they are now withdrawing their plea agreement.  
Atty Renc makes statements. 

Atty Renc makes arguments for amendment to the bond in 14CF409.  Day report was set to 3 days per week.  Asks that it be on court dates only. 
Atty Knaapen makes arguments. 

BY THE COURT: Motion to modify the bond is denied.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 13, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dylan J. Winkler in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Dylan J. Winkler in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Renc

Do not possess any drug paraphernalia.  Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  on days of court

1:25 p.m.
DA Case # 14PT1615
ADA Knaapen  appears in Court.  (Co-Defendant Eli Eckerson 14GF258 is present via video to hear same facts)
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Possess THC for Dylan Winkler & (Bail Jump for Eli Eckerson).
